Walden Mathews <waldenm@...> writes:

> > > It's a long time since I dealt with basic auth... but I thought it
> > > was possible to send the UNAUTHORIZED response to log the user out
> > > and then have the user log in again with another username and
> > > password.
> >
> > In my experience it doesn't work like that :-(
> 
> It certainly can work like that, provided you build the part needed
> on the server.  But it's a logout followed immediately by another
> login, which I'm not sure is the requirement here.

That's right. If you've ever shown a user an app that works like that
you'll not have quickly forgotten the look of disgust you get  /8->


My point about the entity body was that if the UA aways preferred the
display of the entity over popping up it's own dialog then it woiuld
be easy to present a nice UI with basic auth.

The trouble is I guess, that javascript would be needed to send the
basic auth request because there's no syntax in HTML to do it (which
is what kicked this thread off).


Nic
